explosives.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive properties present in the molecules.

self_reactive_substances.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive or self-reactive properties present in the molecule.

self_heating_substances.rationale: Test methods applicable to liquid substances are not available

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures, which in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: The chemical structure of the substance does not contain metals or metaloids(B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At).

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Organic compounds containing oxygen (but not chlorine and fluorine) chemically bonded only to carbon and hydrogen (but not to other elements).

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Although there is also information that it is classified into the UNRTDG class 8 and it corrodes many metals (ICSC (J) (1993)), there is no data based on set test methods.

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Rat LD50 value: 630mg/kg (CERI Hazard Data, 2001, DFGOT vol.13, 1999), and 1780mg/kg (CERI Hazard Data, 2001, DFGOT vol.13, 1999, SIDS, 1997). Based on the above data, it was classified as category 4.

acute_toxicity_dermal.hazard_statement: May be harmful in contact with skin
acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: It was set as Category 5 based on rabbit LD50 value: 4000mg/kg (CERI Hazard Data, 2001, DFGOT vol.13, 1999, SIDS, 1997), and 4321mg/kg (CERI Hazard Data, 2001).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_vapor.rationale: Lower value was adopted from rat LC50 (4 hours) value: 1000ppm (equivalent: 4.167mg/L) (CERI Hazard Data 2001, SIDS, 1997) and 2000ppm (equivalent 8.334mg/L) (CERI Hazard Data, 2001). 1000ppm was considered as the steam with almost no mist from vapor pressure. And classified as Category 3 by the ppm concentration standard.

skin_corrosion_irritation.hazard_statement: Causes severe skin burns and eye damage
skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: There is description that mild to moderate skin stimulativeness was acknowledged in the test which was used the rabbit (CERI Hazard Data (2001), DFGOT (vol.13, 1999), and SIDS (1997)). But from description that serious burn and blister formation are reported in the skin of the humans (CERI Hazard Data (2001) and SIDS (1997)), it was judged that it was caustic, and it was set as Category 1A-1C.

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: There is the description that severe irritant property was acknowledged in the tests applied to the eyes of the rabbits (CERI Hazard Data (2001), DFGOT (vol.13, 1999) and SIDS (1997)), and on the description that the drug-induced severe burn injury on the cornea, loss of eyesight, etc. were reported in the occupational exposure examples (CERI Hazard Data (2001), DFGOT (vol.13, 1999), SIDS (1997) and Japan Society for Occupational Health Recommendation of Occupational Exposure Limits (1990)). So we judged it had causticity and classified it as Category 1.

respiratory_skin_sensitizer.classification: Respiratory sensitization: Classification not possible; Skin sensitization: Classification not possible

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: There is a negative result (SIDS, 1997) by the micronucleus test which used the rat erythrocyte, which is the in vivo mutagenicity tests using a somatic. So it carried out the outside of Category.

toxic_to_reproduction.rationale: There is a description that in an inhalation exposure test using pregnant rats in SIDS (1997) whole embryos absorption was observed in two of four at the concentration in which general toxicity is observed in parental animals. Therefore, it may be classified into Category 2. However, there are only four pregnancy animals in each group, and the data is insufficient. Therefore, since the data is insufficient, it cannot be classified.

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organs/systemic toxicity following single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_statement: Cause damage to organs (respiratory organs); May cause respiratory irritation or may cause drowsiness and dizziness (narcotic effects)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: It was judged as Category 1 (respiratory tracts) because of a description in accidental exposure cases of CERI Hazard Data (2001) referring to confirmation of pulmonary edemas, and of descriptions in DFGOT (13 vol. 1999) and SIDS (1997) referring to that airways can be stimulated seriously and sores of nasal mucosas and bronchospasm may be caused. Moreover, it was judged as Category 3 (anesthetic actions) because of a description in SIDS (1997) referring to confirmation of central nervous system depressions at high concentrations as an effect on humans.

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organs/systemic toxicity following repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_statement: Causes damage to organs (respiratory organs) through prolonged or repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: It was classified into Category 1 (respiratory tracts) from description that the effects on the respiratory system was observed with the concentration within the guidance value range for Category 1 in 13-week inhalation exposure test on rats (SIDS (1997)).

acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 3 from 24-hour LC50=55mg/L of Crustacea(Daphnia magna), and others (SIDS, 2002).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Since rapidly degrading (it hydrolyzed and acetic acid (BOD: 74% (Existing Chemicals Safety Check Data)) is generated, and supposed less bio-accumulative (log Kow=-0.58 (PHYSPROP Database, 2005)).
